data.title: Years Set to Join Roster This Fall
data.meta_description: NEW HAVEN, Conn. – The Yale Women's Squash Team announced its class of 2025 and there are four strong student-athletes in that group. There are three Americans and
data.text:
Women's Squash 2/19/2021 3:26:00 PM Steve Conn

Four First-Years Set to Join Roster This Fall

New Bulldogs Will Impact Lineup

NEW HAVEN, Conn. – The Yale Women's Squash Team announced its class of 2025 and there are four strong student-athletes in that group. There are three Americans and one player from Hong Kong in the new class, though all four come to Yale after playing at schools in the Northeast.

Here is the class of 2025.

Christy Lau

Hong Kong

Brooks School (North Andover, Mass.)

Before Yale: Three-time winner of Hong Kong Junior Squash Championship… Won HEAD Hong Kong Junior Squash Open 2014, runner up in 2012, 4th in 2016… Represented Hong Kong in Asian Junior Individual Squash Tournament (2014, 2016), earning silver and bronze medals… Won Finger Lakes Gold Squash Tournament in 2017… Won NEISA Championships Girls A… Served as squash captain for one year… Recipient of Girls' Squash ISL All-League (2017, 2018, 2019), Girls' Squash ISL MVP (2018, 2019), US Squash All-American (2018), Girls' Squash All-Scholastics (2018), All-NEPSAC Award (2019), and US Squash Scholar-Athlete Award (2018, 2019)

Personal Information: Enjoys singing and playing guitar… BTS Army (Kpop)... Want to travel around the world...

Nina Mital

West Harrison, NY

Hackley School

Before Yale: Attended Hackley School in Tarrytown, N.Y.... Appointed to Hackley's Board of Magistrates... Hackley Academic Dean's List... US Squash All-America 2018-19... Team USA 2018 British Junior Open... Team USA 2019 Pan American Games (Doubles Silver Medal, Team Bronze Medal)... GU19 Highest Rank No. 5... GU17 Highest Rank No 3... GU15 Highest Rank No. 1… No. 3 finish in GU17 at 2019 U.S. Closed Nationals… Took second in GU17 at 2017 African Junior Open

Personal Information: First sports were soccer and softball... Older sister on Yale Squash Team 2017-21... Enjoys traveling and skiing

Fun Fact: "I was so clumsy as a child that my parents never imagined I would become an athlete."

Meghna Sreedhar

Berwyn, Pa.

Baldwin School

Before Yale: Ranked top three at all U.S. junior age groups... No.1 at U15 and U17... Finished U19 career at No.2... U.S. winner of U15 and U17... U.S. finalist at U13 and U15... Selected to represent Team USA at the World Junior Championships 2018, 2020... Four-time US Squash Scholar Athlete Award recipient... Four-time All-American... Captain of Baldwin Squash senior year... Voted high school team and interscholastic athletic conference squash 2019-2020 MVP... 2017 Certificate for Outstanding Contribution to the Life of the Upper School recipient... 2019 Pat West Award winner

Personal Information: Enjoys spending time with family and friends... Daughter of Nandhini Sreedhar and Sreedhar Penagaluru... Sister, Pallavi, attends Columbia University

Lindsay Westerfield

Greenwich, Conn.

Greenwich Academy

Before Yale: Two-time US High School team champion, 2019 and 2020… Elected co-captain of Greenwich Academy for 2020-21… Won 11 US Junior individual tournaments and ranked No. 3 nationally… In the 2018-19 season, was a semi-finalist at US Junior Nationals and took ninth at the US Junior Open and seventh at the Hong Kong Junior Open.

Personal Information: Academic interests are focused on astronomy and physics… Personal passions include women's voting rights worldwide… Founder and President of her high school's Astrophysics and League of Women Voters clubs.

Fun Fact: "I know how to unicycle."
